to discuss something in order to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics
His first aim is to get the warring parties back to the negotiating table  (=discussing something).
Union leaders have negotiated an agreement for a shorter working week.
The government refuses to negotiate with terrorists.
Negotiate is a reciprocal verb This type of verb is used when saying that two or more people or things do something that involves both or all of them
The two sides have to negotiate
The two sides have to negotiate with each other
One side has to negotiate with the other
to succeed in getting past or over a difficult place on a path, road etc
Guido swung the steering-wheel round to negotiate a corner.
to discuss something in order to reach an agreement
Union leaders have negotiated an agreement for a shorter working week.
They negotiated a new contract with the sellers.
The firm is negotiating with its creditors to restructure its debt.
to discuss with a bank or other organization that lends money the amount they will lend you, the rate of interest they will charge etc
to exchange money or goods by using a document such as BILL OF EXCHANGE that allows you to do this
